result.execSummary:
The defendant Darrel C Smalley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay restitution in the amount of $1,000.00 to be paid to Alan P. Restitution is ordered JOINT AND SEVERAL with any co-actors that may be charged in relation to this offense. Restitution to be paid FIRST before costs, fees and surcharges.

Pay all costs, fees, surcharges, and restitution. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge. Court costs, fees, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds and wages.
with credit for 65 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes:
Cognitive thinking class.
If not enrolled in school, defendant is to maintain verifiable employment of at least 30 hours per week.
No contact with the victim Alan P. or the victim in the read-in offense Harper M.
AODA assessment and comply with recommended treatment.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order mailed to SUPERINTENDENT SKALSKI ST CROIX CORRECTIONAL CTR P.O.BOX 36 NEW RICHMOND WI 54017 - 0036

It is ordered that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by DOC Central Records, and will be based upon actual release date.

It is further ordered that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release within 6 working days upon receipt of this order.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 7 Judge  McAdams
records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (37 pages) commencing OCTOBER 14, 2015 received and filed.

Attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg in court, defendant Darrel C Smalley not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for sentencing hearing. Due to the lateness of the hour and calendar congestion, Court ordered this matter adjourned. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
PSI received and filed. Parties notified. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Darrel C Smalley in court with attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Parties are prepared to proceed. State placed negotiations on the record. Plea hearing proceeded.
Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 1-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.

Court ordered a presentence investigation WITH a recommendation.  Order for presentence investigation signed and filed.
Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody.
Court will also conduct a resitution hearing on the next court date. 
Filed:
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment.
Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Victim Impact Statement with attched resitution worksheet received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Darrel C Smalley in court with attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested an adjournment.  State did not object.  Court allowed one adjournment.  Parties were advised that as of August 1, 2015, this calendar will be heard before the Honorable Stephanie G. Rothstein, Branch 25, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  State also requested that this case be set for sentencing and that they will do victim notification.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Darrel C Smalley in court with attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared on behalf of DeAnn L. Heard for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea date.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail are to continue.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Darrel C Smalley in court.  James W. Frisch appeared on behalf of DeAnn L. Heard for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Tishberg unable to appear on today's date. Called the court to obtain another date.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  File retained in court.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Darrel C Smalley in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Mark S. Tishberg also appeared and moved to substitute in as counsel.  Court granted Attorney Tishberg's motion and allowed him to substitute in.  Attorney Jaspers turned over her discovery and an offer letter.  Attorney Tishberg requested a scheduling date.  Court granted same and ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Darrel C Smalley in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp for Deann Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.  Court is in trial.  Defense counsel needs additional discovery.   Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 20.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.   Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Darrel C Smalley in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Michael White, student intern under the supervision of Ronald Dague for Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Darrel C Smalley in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
PER ADA THIS CASE SHOULD BE TABBED TO JUDGE MORONEY BRANCH 20.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4-9-2015 at 1:30pm
